What do you want to do?
[Federation Database] Learn about the storage menu.
(Hibernating Alien) Try to awaken the alien.
Read one of your comic books

At various opportunities you will be given the option to check your storage and do various actions onboard your ship. This can happen in situations such as visiting stores, revisiting an explored beacon, or choosing not to interact with an event. It may look overwhelming at first, but eventually you'll become accustomed to the system. To learn about internal upgrades or the onboard lab, visit the database entries under their respective tabs.

Here you may talk to any crew types you have aboard your ship. Most crew have their own unique sets of dialogue, which provide bits of lore, humor, and sometimes hints for various secrets. You can also scan crew which will provide full details of their stats and other characteristics. Some crew, particularly elites, also have special interactions like upgrading certain systems for cheaper.

Here you may view accomplishments throughout the run and lore entries related to them. The mission report tracks bosses defeated, Renegades encountered, loot items found, and unique crew recruited. The mission report provides no practical benefit but can provide insight on just what you've done along your journey!

You may also choose to engage in various tasks. By default, you'll be able to run salvage missions and repair your hull, but if you find a minelauncher weapon you can also lay a trap for the fleet before sector 8. Salvage missions have many different outcomes, some good and some bad, but can turn up valuable loot. Repairing the hull may be less efficient than at a store, but it can get you out of a tight spot.

The onboard lab can be used to install upgrades for your crew at empty beacons. You can install the lab for free with a level 2 Medbay, otherwise you must use additional resources.
[Federation Database] Learn about the onboard lab.
(Upg. Medbay) Install the lab for free.

Upgrading the lab will allow you to access secondary upgrades for crew, which apply buffs to specific subtypes of crew.
	With level 3 Medbay, you can install the upgrade for free.
(Adv. Medbay) Install the upgrade for free.

The onboard lab, once installed, allows you to install modifications for species and specific crew types. You must have at least one crew of that species to be able to install modifications for it. Unless specified otherwise, all modifications apply retroactively and to crew gained after the modification was installed. Lab modifications come in two forms, primary and secondary.

Primary modifications apply to all crew of a specific species. However, you can only have one primary modification installed per species, and cannot uninstall modifications. Each species has exactly 3 options for primary upgrades, all of which are available as long as you have the lab installed and at least one crew of that species.
Learn about the lab upgrade and secondary modifications.

Once you've installed the lab you may upgrade it once more to unlock secondary modifications. Unlike primary mods, secondary mods only apply to specific crew types. No crew type has more than one secondary mod, and you may install multiple secondaries under the same species. You do not need a crew member of that subtype to install a secondary for it.

Internal Upgrades carry many different passive functions similar to augments, but can be installed at any storage check and do not fill augment slots. Internal augments do not always cost just scrap. As you purchase more systems (or fill other requirements) more options will appear. Some internal upgrades may be mutually exclusive with other upgrades. You can select an internal augment to preview a description of its function before purchasing it.

While somewhat rare outside of starting configurations for certain ships, you may sometimes find special augments marked with an [X]. These augments will provide their function normally as an augment, but can be converted to the internal version for free under the purchase menu.
			External augments do not count towards mutually exclusive upgrades or upgrade limits. However, once you exchange them for their internal version they will, so be careful!
			Converting an external augment to internal cannot be undone.
Learn about arms and modular [M] variants.

Under the internal upgrade menu you can also install and uninstall arms. Each arm has a different effect, but you can only have one at a time. Uninstalling arms gives back half of the price to install it.
			Similar to external augments, you can find Modular Arms marked by an [M] on rare occasions. Modular arms do not count towards the arm limit but take an augment slot. However, Modular Arms cannot be internalized.
			The arm menu is located under "Onboard Tech".

A dark gloom consumes the ship, overwhelming your senses with the sounds of screams and the scent of rotting flesh. When the gloom has gone away, the ship is in horrible disrepair, and you are haunted by a feeling of regret.

You look through your comic books. What do you want to read?

The vibrant panels tell the enthralling tale of a Zoltan warrior named Devorak Rei, an underdog soldier stuck in the middle of the Federation-Mantis War fighting for the Ministry alongside Human and Engi companions. In the end, Devorak stands triumphant but scarred from his experiences with the Mantis. Short but sweet, and surprisingly historically accurate.

After the events of the Federation-Mantis War, Devorak is honored by the Ministry as a hero and put in charge of their peacekeeper training program. However, he is left broken after his lost brother Biene is declared dead after having been missing in action for years. This leads to a greater internal struggle when the Federation erected a memorial to Node 17, which listed only the names of the humans who lost their lives, and nothing of the Zoltan or Engi soldiers who had faught just as valiantly. The comic ends with Devorak struggling with where his allegiances will fall.

The third comic opens straight into the violent turmoil of the Free Mantis genocides, where Devorak witnesses firsthand the Federation's inaction against unjust cruelty towards his people. Finally broken, Devorak turns to a rising Duskbringer movement and begins to recruit new members through the academy at which he teaches. At the end of the comic, the Ministry discovers his secret, and he flees to the Duskbringer Capitol to escape punishment. A bitter end to the story, but that's about as much as much of his origins as the Federation knows.

You open the comic to find a fairly accurate retelling of Tully's past. Starting from his birth in the Union, Tully leads an uneventful life within a small industrial mining colony to impoverished parents. Suddenly, he is thrust into the center of the new rising galactic conflict when Mantis invaders destroy his colony and kill everyone he loves, leading to him enlisting in the Union military to fight back against the Mantis threat.

You're surprised to find in the second comic one of Tully's first accomplices is none other than Admiral Vance Wentworth himself! Already a high ranking star-commander, Vance shows Tully the ropes and soon they become fast friends. However, they are split up for some time until Tully is captured during a mission and brought to a central Mantis POW camp where Vance is already being kept. Both are tortured beyond belief but remain resilient and eventually lead a movement against their captors, escaping but not without the deaths of several dozen other prisoners.

In the third comic Tully wanders lost throughout the frozen hellscape he is trapped on, saved only just in time by a small band of Mantis scientists taking refuge after having tried to escape the Hive themselves. He meets a young mantis named Tiifleeiiik, who he becomes good friends with, and learns the native Mantis language of Yeitiiik. At the end of the comic, Vance returns to the Federation front-lines and a search party is sent out for Tully, who returns to the Federation safely. This leads to one final assault on Tiet III, the heart of the Mantis war machine, where the Hive surrenders and the Federation is delcared the victor.

Everyone knows the stories of the Federation-Mantis War, but these comics provide a unique point of view from that of the Leeches, who played a small but important role in the conflict. The story begins with a peaceful day on humanity's homeworlds, Earth. Suddenly, a Mantis invasion descends on the planet, but is defeated by the human forces along with the power of the Gatling gun, a revolutionary advancement in technology created by Jackson Newman and produced by Zulfiqar Armaments. Though Earth survives, humankind is shaken and ready for war.

The Mantis continue to aggress the situation, thirsting for conquest, and launch attacks against the Harmony and the Ministry. Frightened, Union Senator Adrian Novikov arranges to meet with the Harmony and Minister Lumei, and together they form a trade alliance known as the Federation. However, in the meantime, conflicts stirring within the Eargen Republic and Floral Gathering lead to the opposing force known as the Trifecta, consisting of the Hive, Eargen Republic, and the Carnivora.

Now having evolved into a full-scale galactic conflict, both sides lead constant attacks against each other. The conflict goes on for 5 years, with the Hive relying heavily on the support of its two main allies. However, the tides turn when the Vampweeds and Florals signed the treaty of Kadahellian'ek, promising to avoid conflict with each other. Furthermore, a military coup within the Republic led to the public assasination of the former leader Aerkae who had firmly supported the Hive. Without any allies left, the Hive finally surrendered after its defeat during the battle of Tiet III.

You are now viewing the mission report. Here you can see any secrets or special events you've encountered on this run!
	If a category appears empty, it means you have not found anything that goes there yet.
When you kill or pacify (in the case of a special victory condition) a boss, it will appear here.
Prophet Of the Great Eye [Free Mantis Hunting Grounds]
When you kill a Multiverse Renegade Cruiser, it will appear here.

CLASS: EHG Cruiser
			FACTION: Exotic Hunter's Guild
			
			Constructed originally by the Kleptocracy as an early model of a light cruiser, engineers soon realized the absurd wingspan of this vessel made it both impractical to maneuver and to store in their traditionally cramped hangars. Though originally planned to be discarded entirely, the original prototype ended up in the hands of one of the earliest Guild rangers, a friend of the residing king Terlack. Taking a liking to the idea of the Guild having an appropriately extravagant cruiser model of their own, full scale production within privately owned shipyards commenced soon-there-after. This little known and only moderately interesting tale is among many of similar stories engraved on Terlack's tomb, which is so long it is believed no mortal Slug could read it within an average lifespan.

CLASS: Imperial Cruiser
			FACTION: Crystalline Empire
			
			The origins of the initial design of the Imperial Cruiser have been lost to time, though some historians (or wannabe grave robers) claim they can be found sealed away inside the ancient crypt of the distant Emperor Ycathine constructed underneath Wria, the Crystalline Homeworlds. No one really believes this since the vault likely doesn't exist at all, and many people have emerged claiming to be the descendents of the original engineer responsible. This includes a couple Crystal aristocrats, one of Empress Dianesh's 20 times removed cousins, and once a very delusional Leech.

CLASS: Duskbringer Cruiser
			FACTION: The Duskbringers
			
			At the start of their rise to infamy, the Duskbringers first used old science vessels stolen from the Ministry. Over time as their identity evolved and the movement gained more traction, the brightest minds of the Duskbringers gathered together and crafted a warship capable of rivaling the Ministry's strongest cruiser. Now the pride and joy of the Duskbringers, many a heated debate has started over the superiority of the vessel.

CLASS: Harmony Cruiser
			FACTION: The Engi Harmony
			
			Fashioned from a living swarm of trillions of nanites, the Harmony Cruiser may look like a mound of garbage, but underneath the hood is an extremely efficient network. Many foolish marauders, especially the odd slaver, have mistakenly interpreted the ship's small size as a sign of weakness, but they couldn't be further from the truth. There's many a legend, strange as it may be, of sightings of Harmony Cruisers "mating" and producing smaller ships from the aftermath.

CLASS: Engineer Cruiser
			FACTION: The Rebellion
			
			The Rebellion's Engineer Corps have gained considerable military tract, mostly a show of dominant strength. In suit, it was only fitting they be given a mighty vessel capable of both immense military strength and utility. The wide-reaching wingspan of the Engineer Cruiser has become iconic, and the glistening paint-job of Engineer vessels is the subject of envy of many an underfunded Federation captain.

CLASS: Federation Cruiser
			FACTION: The Federation
			
			The successor to the preliminary and outdated Kestrel Cruiser, the once unfinished prototype of the Federation Cruiser was recovered during the Civil War after having been stolen by the Rebels and utilized to fashion the Rebel Flagship's infamous artillery. Now in widescale production, the somewhat unfortunate shape of these ships comes secondhand in embarrassment only to the widespread dislike for the unwieldly charge times of the artillery weapons. Thanks to the prosperous wealth of Universe 0 however, newer models feature much more sophisticated technology that has allowed these cruisers to compete with other state of the art ships in the Multiverse era.

CLASS: Free Mantis Cruiser
			FACTION: The Free Mantis
			
			Fashioned haphazardly out of parts of smaller Hive ships by early Free Mantis engineers, this ship is almost older than the movement itself. With the first model being created and captained by the now well known Free Mantis revolutionary Freddy, many Free Mantis have created replicas. Though each version has a few signature differences, the striking accuracy at which the Free Mantis have faithfully recreated their precious cruiser is nothing but a testament to the unstoppable capabilities of a hard determined Mantis.

CLASS: Kestrel Cruiser
			FACTION: The Federation
			
			Perhaps the most iconic model still in circulation, the Kestrel was once on the way out. With fewer than a hundred models still in use at the start of the Civil War, after the hero of Universe 0 defeated the Rebel Flagship aboard their own classic Kestrel, a newfound craze took storm of the galaxy and Kestrels began widespread production once again. Almost driving the new prototype Federation cruiser project to death, the two cruisers manage to run in harmony, with the Kestrel now serving a more civilian use for middle-class Union citizens and upstart Renegades.

CLASS: Lanius Cruiser
			FACTION: The Swarm
			
			The sweeping blades of the Lanius Cruiser, though once suspected to be some sort of bizzare defensive protrusion, actually appear to be some sort of ritualistic inclusion. Far from spiritual, the Lanius' unique aesthetic seems to be driven by a more natural, innate force. Always well armed, cruisers like these have become a terror for any settler who found themselves too close to the area of influence of the re-emerging Swarm during the Civil War.

CLASS: Lost Sun Cruiser
			FACTION: The Lost Suns
			
			For the first several years of the Lost Sun revolution, their fleet lacked any distinct livery. Upon seeing the unifying power the rather simple but distinct paintjobs used by fellow revolutionaries like the Duskbringers and Free Mantis however, Lost Sun Admiral Ariadne jumped at the opportunity and quickly seized hold of a Theocracy shipyard. Though most Lost Sun vessels are smaller in size, a few cruisers such as these can be seen terrorizing Theocracy fleets with their immense firepower.

CLASS: Hive Cruiser
			FACTION: The Mantis Hive
			
			Near the time of the Federation-Mantis War (when it was still known as the Human-Mantis War)'s beginning, the Hive only employed the use of smaller, mobile vessels for quick deployment. When the war shifted towards later conflicts between fleets thanks to the added might of the Ministry fleet, the Hive began to invest in larger warships. The dreaded Hive Cruiser keeps the maneuverability and sleek build of the original fleet but can fit a larger arsenal and supporting crew.

CLASS: Illesctrian Cruiser
			FACTION: The Zoltan Ministry
			
			Though it may seem unusual for the pacifist and non-militaristic monks to carry a warship of this size, but in fact the impressive size and defensive strength of these ships has dissuaded many an otherwise marauder from harming the monks. Built after the genocidal attacks of the Infernals on Monk space, these cruisers now carry entire clergies across the galaxy to spread the words of their faith, as well as serving as sanctuaries for Ministry politicians and refugees.
When you recruit special crew, they will appear here.

PROFILE: Sherlock Haynes
			Titles: SDM (Standard Defense Militia) Detective, (Former) Multiverse Renegade
			Species: Human - Age: 36 - Gender: Male
			
			Haynes was born a citizen of the Galactic Union on the infamous Antiquum Terrae. After his home was ravaged by blood thirsty, gigantic insects called the Vek, he left his past behind to seek out his dreams of becoming a detective for the Militia. He's fairly well known as a Multiverse Renegade, popping in to help various realities whenever he can. Unfortunately, he'll probably never get over his entomophobia, but his old-fashioned revolver was forged from the metal of an Alpha Scarab's shell as revenge.

PROFILE: Brodric Tully
			Title: Federation Admiral
			Species: Human - Age: 57 - Gender: Male
			
			Tully is a man who lives up to his legend, if not more. Born to a penniless family of Union miners and orphaned by a Mantis attack, Tully has been serving in the Federation since the Federation first began. Maybe, if you survive this mission, Tully can sit you down and tell you some stories from his past. But for now, you have a Flagship ahead to prepare for and no time to lose.

PROFILE: Captain A5540L3
			Title: Pirate King
			Species: Cognitive - Age: 8 - Gender: Male
			
			A55 is one of the only three known cognitives in the galaxy, alongside CICA and the Harmony. Having been created by the Rebellion in an attempt to replicate CICA post-civil war, the engineers began to refer to the cognitive as A5540L3, though the AI managed to revolt and escape captivity, while keeping his title. How he became a pirate king is a bit hazy and A55 himself seems to have conflicted stories, but all that matters is he's on your side, and not the Rebellion's.

PROFILE: Jerome Wentworth
			Title: Rebel Officer
			Species: Human - Age: 23 - Gender: Male
			
			Jerome, or "Jerry" as he prefers to be called, is the nephew to none other than Admiral Vance himself. He used to aspire to be just like his Uncle, but after an unpleasant experience with a raid against Orchid space he felt differently. Before he met you, he wasn't confident enough to stand up to Vance, but now he hopes he might be able to plead with the good side that he knows is in there and maybe put an end to this war.

PROFILE: Devorak "The Deathless" Ralai
			Title: Duskbringer General
			Species: Zoltan - Age: 54 - Gender: Male
			
			Devorak was once a devoted Zoltan Peacekeeper, but when he started to see cracks in the Ministry, he eventually jumped sides to the Duskbringers. Now that he's on your side, you've learned he never really liked either. The mysterious leaders of the Duskbringer movement tended to use him as an errand runner, rather than as the noble soldier who people assumed was associated with his title. With his glory days in both the Ministry and Duskbringers over, he figures it's high time he switches to the Federation for once.

PROFILE: T-RZ1L (Turzil)
			Title: (Former) Chief Defender of the Harmony
			Species: Engi - Age: 65 - Gender: N/A
			
			Turzil was once the proud* General of the Engi Brigade, the Harmony's finest defenders. That is, until Universe 0 Turzil was caught breaking the non-aggression pact between the Harmony and the Rebellion, and sentenced to death alongside his entire squadron. The Harmonies, united across the Multiverse, declared Turzil an interdimensional fugitive. The bounty for him is so high he still isn't certain you won't turn him in. If he can prove himself a hero in this reality as well, maybe the Federation will grant him safety from the Harmony.
			(*This is a figure of speech. Engi cannot feel pride.)

PROFILE: Alkali Mardovar
			Title: Chief Science Officer of the Geniocracy
			Species: Shell - Age: 51 - Gender: Male
			
			Professor Alkali, head of the Geniocracy science district, is not your friend. He is nobody's friend. An arrogant man and proud atheist, Alkali has a spiteful view on not only those outside of the Geniocracy but those inside the Geniocracy. Frankly, he'd much prefer he be left alone with his experiments. But now that his latest experiments have been foiled by the Rebellion and Nerva's sabotage, he's deadset on getting revenge. You're just his vessel for that. Or at least, so he claims.

PROFILE: OOJ MAJOO
			Title: Big blob thing
			Species: Morph - Age: N/A - Gender: N/A
			
			Every Morph you've ever seen has all been but a piece of OOJ. In a sense, they are all him. Yet, they act individually. The large grey blob whom the "true" OOJ gave to you is nothing but another, larger fragment of his eternally growing and dividing colony of morphs. You might not know what he's saying, but fortunately he can understand you and clearly has the best of intentions.

PROFILE: Gregory Nights
			Title: (Former) King of the Kleptocracy
			Species: Slug - Age: 48 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
			
			The fact this drugged and drunk loser is king might be surprising, but he wasn't always this way. Always an asshole, yes, but Nights was once a revered pirate captain comparable to other famous names like Tuco or Kazaaakplethkilik. Being the son of two devout reformists, Nights always took a political tone to his work as a bounty hunter. Having become a cultural icon within the Kleptocracy during a time when Slocknog's expansion wars were growing even more unpopular, Nights took it upon himself to seize the crown. And yes, his real first name is Gregory.

PROFILE: Slocknog Dssilli
			Title: (Former) King of the Kleptocracy
			Species: Slug - Age: 48 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
			
			Slocknog was once the king of the Kleptocracy not long ago, but he was also the one responsible for the infamous Slug Expansion Wars. These conflicts were greatly unpopular among the Slug people, which led to his eventual overthrowal in favor of Nights. Slocknog is adamantly against the Coalition, but also against the idealogies of Reformism that have led to such heavy human influence on Slug culture. If he had his way, the Slugs would remain their own entirely independent entity, and he's not afraid to make that known to anyone who'll listen.

PROFILE: Irwin Silza
			Titles: Multiverse Renegade, (Former) Exotic Hunters Guild Chairman
			Species: Slug - Age: 44 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
			
			Irwin is one of the most famous Clansmen Rangers since the EHG was first formed. As a young child, he dreamed of being a Multiverse Renegade, but the Federation was too protective over this technology to let anybody, especially a Slug, get their hands (or tentacles) on it. The EHG looked like the only option to get a taste of adventure, and so his travels as a Clansman began. Apparently at some point he even was their chairman, but through circumstances he refuses to talk about, he was exiled.

PROFILE: Alkram Tripae
			Title: (Former) General of the Eargen Republic
			Species: Leech - Age: 56 - Gender:  Male
			
			Alkram was once the general of the Eargen Republic's military forces during the Federation-Mantis War under leadership of Aerkae. After his assasination and the Eargen Republic's distancing from the Hive, Alkram retired from the military and for several years watched as his people were flung into further turmoil until the appointment of Tyrdeo. Highly skeptical of Tyrdeo's motives, Alkram eventually decided it was time to take action and seize control of the Republic. He failed, as you already know, but he doesn't seem too bothered by it anymore.

PROFILE: Tyrdeo Poeka
			Title: (Former) President of the Eargen Republic
			Species: Leech - Age: 31 - Gender:  Male
			
			Apparently, Tyrdeo never wanted to be president of the Republic. Sort of. He was once a gardener for the wealthier Leech aristocrats and from them he gained many eccentric dreams of power. Seeing the opportunity, Tyrdeo began to parade himself as the best choice as Aerkae's replacement. This, for some reason, worked, and he was put in charge while failing to understand what his job as president was. He's an idiot, a coward, and very self-absorbed, but he's also strangely quite endearing and eager to prove himself.

PROFILE: Tiifleeiiik 'Freddy' Kitetiiikiplik
			Title: Free Mantis Founder
			Species: Mantis - Age: 65 - Gender: Male
			
			Freddy is very reluctant to talk about his sensitive past, but you've managed to gather this much from him; he was once an engineer for the Hive attempting to flee from the industrial coreworlds of Tiet III along with various other Mantis scientists - the first Free Mantis. At some point Freddy met a human companion, an escapee from a nearby Mantis POW camp. From this man he earned his name and his excellent understanding of the human dialect. Freddy refused to use the synthetic pheromones that his fellow Free Mantis are known for, but understands that without the concoction his people would not last for very long.

PROFILE: Kazaaakplethkilik Tiiikazpakaziiika
			Titles: Honorary Suzerain, Pirate
			Species: Mantis - Age: 72 - Gender: Male
			
			This Mantis pirate has more to his name than just his extensive count collection of letters. He is queen Leikonpliiinakra's chosen suitor. This relationship seems to be considered taboo by his people and many see him as a traitor after rumors of him acting as an informant for the Federation during the Fed-Mantis war got out. Now, he's spent his days campaigning against the Hive's involvement in the Coalition. Maybe there's more to this warrior than meets the eye?

PROFILE: Empress Dianesh Kryel
			Title: Empress of the Crystalline Empire
			Species: Crystal - Age: 378 - Gender: Female
			
			The Empress is older than the Federation itself, and has lived through the collapse of the Rock-Crystal Empire as well as the Federation Civil War. Through all of this it seems she has taken away one key thing - her people are rarely influenced positively by the skirmishes of foreign species. Being a skilled warrior herself, she has pledged her abilities to you to give your people a final chance. Try to impress her, or else the Crystalline-kind's stay in the new open Multiverse might be a very short one.

PROFILE: Sir Ruwen Argote
			Title: Foreign Ambassador of the Crystalline Empire
			Species: Crystal - Age: ??? - Gender: Male
			
			Ruwen is the official Ambassador of the Crystalline Empire towards the outside world. Chosen for this position because of his unique role aboard the vessel that defeated the original Flagship, Ruwen has had a taste of both sides. Make no mistake, Ruwen's loyalty will always fall first on that of the Empire, but he is far from sharing the same xenophobic views as many other Crystals.

PROFILE: Ariadne Obadann
			Title: Admiral of the Lost Suns
			Species: Rockman - Age: 27 - Gender: Female
			
			Ariadne is quite young to be the leader of such an aggressive resistance movement, but her past is nothing but tragic. Since she was only 3, she was arranged into marriage with none other than the Head Elder Toarde by her own father to bestow even greater power on their family. Ariadne never married Toarde as she managed to escape with help of her much older brother, a former Crusader. Together the two formed the Lost Suns, but after a fallout because of their different views over the Crystal people, her brother vanished and Ariadne took full control.

PROFILE: Rowbad 'Tuco' Eterrio
			Title: Dread Pirate, Private Bodyguard
			Species: Rockman - Age: 42 - Gender: Male
			
			Once named Rowbad long ago, the now infamous Tuco carries the title of an ancient Rock renegade during the days of the Rock-Crystal Empire. He's been on many adventures and is considered a hero by the Rock outcasts, but his glory days are long behind him. After being spoiled by the high-life as smuggler-king Ocym's private bodyguard, he spends most of his free time drunk aboard the Sky-Drifter Casino.

PROFILE: The Beacon Eater
			Title: Lanius King
			Species: Lanius - Age: ??? - Gender: N/A
			
			The Beacon Eater has been the king of the Lanius for millenia. His body is covered in a thick cover of rust, and it's a miracle nothing has killed him over the three separate hibernations he's endured. Apparently, his swarm isn't the only one around, but he won't indulge further information.

PROFILE: The Anointed
			Title: Augmented Queen
			Species: Lanius (Augmented) - Age: ??? - Gender: Female
			
			The Anointed was the first of the Augmented to split away from the Swarm. When she discovered the abundant food source in the recovery sites, she guided many fellow Lanius to this new oasis, so that they might avoid the long, dreadful hibernation that their species is often forced to go through. Her sudden change of heart seems to be attributed to her sense of mystery - she wants to figure this all out as much as you.

PROFILE: Dessius Yan Tartodicus
			Title: Prime Reaper of the Spectral Dynasty
			Species: Phantom Alpha - Age: 784 - Gender: N/A
			
			Dessius is the 16th prime Reaper, and he's been around for a long time. So long, that he can remember a time before the Federation. Truth is, he knows there's more to the Auto-threat than that they're just 'demons', but he can't let his people know without mass panic. He's put his faith in your knowledge on CICA and the Flagship, and if your intel is right, you might finally be able to make peace between the Dynasty and Federation at long last.

PROFILE: ???
			Title: Giant Alien Spider Queen
			Species: Giant Alien Spider - Age: 24 - Gender: Female
			
			The Queen, while not the only way for the spiders to reproduce, produces the bulk of the future spider offspring through laying eggs in massive underground hatcheries, or in storage cabinets on your ship. You expected this massive, untamed beast to cause more problems aboard your ship, but she mostly sleeps or playfully romps around the ship, when she isn't busy devouring your enemies alive that is.

PROFILE: Obyn Arokem
			Title: Multiverse Renegade
			Species: Saltman - Age: 50 - Gender: Male
			
			Obyn is, as far as he knows, the last of his kind. After seeing his family massacred by the EHG, he's sworn to hunt down and kill every last Clansman involved. In the meantime though, he makes a pretty penny as a bounty hunter. He has a long and complicated past with Sylvan from what you understand, but he doesn't talk about it much. It seems personal, so it's better not to ask too much.

PROFILE: Rig
			Title: Zulfiqar Chief Marketing Officer
			Species: Rockman - Age: 65 - Gender: Male
			
			Rig is a pretty important executive at Zulfiqar, so hopefully they don't mind what you've done to him. He seems to be in constant misery and always throwing up in the ship's toilet, much to the dismay of Tintan. Still, he refuses to seek help because of his stubborn determination to prove his perseverance... and also probably because he's absolutely terrified of surgery.

PROFILE: Tintan
			Title: Ministry Envoy
			Species: Zoltan - Age: 53 - Gender: Female
			
			Tintan is nothing but your ordinary Ministry representative - or at least she would be if it wasn't for the fact she's now stuck inside of Rig. Only Rig can hear what she says and the two are frequently arguing, but it's hard to say how much of that is because of their situation and how much is because they just can't agree with each other. Not that Tintan has much of a choice.

PROFILE: Tony Senior
			Title: Founder and CEO of Tony's
			Species: Leech - Age: 40 - Gender: Male
			
			This overweight and depressed Leech is the owner of perhaps the best known galactic retail chain in the galaxy, known simply as "Tony's". 7 years ago Tony was a happy and fit man, but now he's nothing but a mess. Considering in those 7 years he also got so rich it's hard to say what happened, and for some reason Tony doesn't want to talk about it.

PROFILE: Grand Priest Lord Vortigon Obadann XIV, Devout Follower and Leader of the Followers of the Eternal Ember and Keeper of the Holy Texts
			Title: Grand Priest and Devout Follower and Leader of the Followers of the Eternal Ember and Keeper of the Holy Texts
			Species: Rockman (Augmented) - Age: 38 - Gender: Male
			
			Vortigon is... an interesting fellow. He took the words of the Elders to heart, and he believes in more than any other of the power of the Crystals. However, he wasn't a fan of the Elders themselves, so he, along with a band of several other Rockmen, set out to find the Crystalline Origins themselves. Somewhere along the way he went absolutely mad from overdosing on Crystalline stimulants, and you aren't sure why he's sticking with you. Maybe he's just so desperate for a friend he's willing to give anyone, even a Federation captain who almost killed him, a chance.

PROFILE: Billy Hektar
			Title: CEO of Hektar Industries
			Species: Slug - Age: 49 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
			
			Billy has done a lot of awful things, including slavery. Despite this, he can't be blamed entirely for them when he was held at gunpoint from one of the galaxy's most dangerous men. He also genuinely seems to regret his actions, especially concerning his long lost twin brother who used to run the company alongside him. Billy expects this mission to finally turn his life around, but maybe it's best not to tell him the Federation has no control over Kleptocracy tax collection.

PROFILE: Sylvan
			Title: Traveling Merchant
			Species: Slug - Age: 49 - Gender: Hermaphrodite (culturally male)
			
			Basically nothing about Sylvan's past is clear, but it's hard to deny that he's always been your most loyal ally. You aren't certain what makes him like you so much, and sometimes it's even unnerving the lengths he'll go to help you, but it's good to have someone stand by you in the face of such adversities.

PROFILE: Aenwithe
			Title: Obelisk Revolutionary, (Former) Cognitive Engineer
			Species: Obelisk - Age: Roughly 80000 - Gender: N/A (culturally male)
			
			Aenwithe is a friendly (if not somewhat narcissistic), well spoken (if not overly talkative), and most certainly well traveled Obelisk. He was once an engineer working on the Harmony project until he defected after what he refers to as the "Prometheus Incident." Now, he's determined to make true the ancient myths of the Paragon and destroy the Multiverse to ensure the security of civilization.

PROFILE: Laiiikarkapi Karzka
			Title: Mantis Bishop
			Species: Mantis - Age: 36 - Gender: Female
			
			The first female Bishop, Queen Leikonpliiinakra appointed Laiiikarkapi as protector of the prized royal Hatchery. However, her loyalty to the eggs far outgrew her loyalty to the queen. So much so, that she was willing to betray her monarch to save the future offspring from the horrible life of a ruthless warrior that she wishes herself to never have endured. Strangely cuddly and kind-hearted for a Mantis, no less.

PROFILE: Guntput
			Title: Tribal Warrior
			Species: Furry One Eyed Tree Lizard Thing - Age: 37 - Gender: Male
			
			When the Hektar vessels first arrived on the lizard homeworlds, many of the lizards were amazed by their wonderous technology. No one listened to Guntput's warnings, no thanks to Metyunt, a prominent friend of the tribe's chieftain, who sided with Hektar since the beginning. When the lizards began to be shipped away to work in the Mega-Market only then did the Lizards realize the truth to Guntput's words. Now, the last few remaining lizards see modern technology as an all encompassing evil, but Guntput trusts you just enough to give you a chance.

PROFILE: Metyunt
			Title: Hektar Manager
			Species: Furry One Eyed Tree Lizard Thing - Age: 40 - Gender: Male
			
			Metyunt is a traitor to his people and a coward at that. When the Hektar ships first arrived on his home planet, he was quick to strike a deal with Hektar in return for his own liberty. However, it's clearly taken a toll on him, and now he's desperate to find a way to repay for his crimes.

data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your human reflects on the beauty of space. You spend a while staring out the window together watching the stars twinkle.
Your human has a low opinion of spaceship food. You can't say you disagree.
Your human is busy ironing their uniform. You try to make small talk, but inevitably give up.
Your human dislikes spiders. A lot.

Your human expresses their deep fear of death. You comfort them and try to convince them that at the very least if they die on this mission, it'll be quick and painless. You make sure to cross your fingers behind your back.
Your human talks a great deal about old Earth history. You try your best to stay awake.
Your human is hopeful about this mission.
Your human asks about sick days. You pretend that you can't hear them.
Your human misses their family, but they understand the importance of the mission.
After a brief chat with your human, you realize how truly boring they are.
Your human is afraid of heights. They aren't sure what they think about space.
Your human is fast asleep in their quarters. You try to not bother them.
Your human asks you about your favourite type of music. The conversation doesn't last very long.
Your human is busy, and promises they'll talk with you later.
Your human jumps when you enter their quarters, and shuts off their holo-tablet's screen. You slowly step back out of the room.
Your human wishes there was better exercise equipment on the ship.
Your human can't think of anything to talk about.
Your human confesses they wished they stayed back at their home, but it's too late to quit now.
Your human wishes that if they are to die, that they die in a big explosion.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with your Engineer?

ENGINEER DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Human] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard
	Stats: 60% damage from fire. Repairs at 1.2x speed. Learns repair skills even faster.
	Inherited Stats: 83% damage from suffocation. Learns skills 10% faster.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your Engineer thinks all crew should be replaced with drones. They're much less annoying to talk to as well. Mostly because they don't talk.
Your Engineer thinks spending droneparts is a worthy price of the power of drones.
Your Engineer sometimes wishes they had a mask to wear while welding, instead of closing their eyes tight and washing the charred skin off later.
Your Engineer thinks your ship is boring looking, and needs more fancy lights.
Your Engineer is working on a prototype sentry deployment system. It's too far from finished to even be considered using on the ship.
Your Engineer is busy practicing combat against a test dummy using its wrench as a weapon.
Your Engineer is considering becoming a streamer after this mission is over, because it pays much better than their current career.
Your Engineer tells you that you pay much better than their old employer. You're confused, as you do not pay your crew anything.
You cannot find your Engineer anywhere. The ship computer informs you they are busy trying to work up the courage to replace their arm with a robotic one.
Your Engineer tries to talk with you, but you get lost after they start talking about the importance of Cryo-Inducing the Dispersion Betatron Drive.
Your Engineer wonders why the standard Rebel vessels don't have logos, when the Elite and Engineer ones do.
Your Engineer tells you how the Rebel Engineer vessels were the original designs for Rebel ships, but were deemed "too high-tech looking" and therefore handed down to the Engineers instead.
Your Engineer wonders how confusing it would be for the Rebel Engineers if everyone stopped shortening the Engis' names.
Your Engineer is afraid of AI. They tell you to watch your back, because you never know when the computers are listening.
Your Engineer believes everyone will be looking for cybernetic enhancements not long in the future.
Your Engineer wishes they could have a real welding torch instead of a weird flaming stick thing.
Your Engineer wonders why they take less damage from fires.
Your Engineer is busy practicing the Kazotsky Kick.
Your Engineer hopes to be famous for something important. Too bad all the good, scientifically impossible ideas are already taken.

	SPECIES? [Human] SUBTYPE? [Yes]

	Inherited Stats: 83% damage from fire and suffocation. Learns skills (other than combat) 10% faster.
	Ability (30s cooldown): Heal self and nearby friendlies for 50 health.
	Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your medic hopes you don't mind that they never actually got their medical licence.
Your medic appreciates the intricacies of the medical bomb, and requests that you invest in more of the tech for the ship.
Your medic advises taking risks when it comes to crew safety whenever it'll help, because they can always be patched up afterwards.
Your medic despises Clone Bays, calling them 'Medbays for lazy people'.
Your medic cares not for morality or warcrimes when there is science to be performed.
Your medic finds it insulting that they were never properly trained for combat despite being deployed for work on military vessels.
Your medic wishes the cross on their uniform came in different colors.
Your medic promises that they do in fact have hair underneath their hat.
Your medic finds that traditional medical ethics are only an obstacle.
Your medic briefly apologizes for selling the souls of the crew, before running off again. You're very confused.
Your medic advises you train the rest of the crew on how to properly use... they stop mid-sentence and walk out of the room, leaving you baffled.
Your medic hopes to have the opportunity to perform surgery on every sapient race in the galaxy some day.
Your medic hands you a stick of deodorant and advises you start using it more often.
Your medic wants a Rockman companion to accompany them. Even better, perhaps with a minigun.
Your medic has passed out in their quarters after an unsuccessful attempt at performing an experiment on themselves.
Your medic is trying to train themselves to not need to breathe so that they can remove their lungs to make more room for a storage cavity. It's not working out very well.
Your medic hates having white uniforms because of all the dried bloodstains.
Your medic advises letting them go on boarding operations, even though they aren't an amazing fighter.

Have your Soldier help with upgrading the engines.

SOLDIER DETAILS

Your Soldier has training in operating and repairing engine systems. They can upgrade the system for cheaper than normal.
Your engines are too weak for your Soldier to help.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.

data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your Soldier wishes he didn't always have to wear this suit of armor. When you tell him that he actually doesn't need to, he glares at you and walks away.
Your Soldier has seen many horrors on the battlefield, but he's new to space warfare. He likes it much better here.
Your Soldier is busy shining his handheld laser cannon. He's too concentrated on the task to talk.
Your Soldier likes to live a simple life of infiltrating enemy defenses, sabotaging supply lines, rescuing hostages, and assasinating corrupt political leaders.
Your Soldier pledges undying loyalty to you, so long as you never do anything he doesn't like.
Your Soldier understands that you must sometimes take morally void actions if they are for the greater good.
Your Soldier has a secret fondness for jokes, but his training does not allow him to laugh unless necessary for distracting the opponent.
Your Soldier thinks you need to upgrade the doors more. He who controls the doors controls space, according to him.
Your Soldier hates nebulas, and he hates Slugs. Ghosts are alright though, and provide a unique advantage in spy operations.
Your Soldier doesn't want to be identified as a xenophobe, but he is very uneasy around aliens.
Your Soldier advises you never put untrained crew in the line of fire unless the airlocks are malfunctioning.
Your Soldier thinks dying in anything other than battle would be a disappointment.
Your Soldier thinks drones can provide a unique advantage in some situations, but that nothing can ever go wrong with a Teleporter and the right team of crew.
Your Soldier thinks a crew of only well trained soldiers will be your best defense against the Flagship.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with Tully?

TULLY DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Human] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Unique
	Stats: 200 Health, 1.5x repair and extinguishing speed, 1.25x move speed, 1.5x combat damage, 50% fire and suffocation damage. Has maximum skill level.
	Aura: Grants nearby friendly crew 25% bonus movement speed.
	Ability (20s cooldown, 5s duration): Rally your crew, granting them 2.5x combat damage and movement speed, and 2x repair speed. Covers the entire ship.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Tully is apprehensive of the final fight. He's only seen holographic images of the Flagship before, and he can hardly wait to witness its glory in person. And destroy it, too.
"I must say, this is one well stocked ship. Almost as good as my own. Too bad it was destroyed by the damn Rebels."
"This is a very well trained crew that you have. I must visit the training facilities in Universe 0 some time."
"I wonder what it's like, living in a reality where the Rebels are just barely a threat. After this is over, I will visit some other, more peaceful, realities."
Tully wants nothing more than to rid the galaxy of the Rebel forces.
"No Rebel's crimes will go unpunished, but we must remember to stay fair and just while prosecuting them. We must never let anything like this happen again."
Tully suggests checking every system one last time before the final fight.
Tully has nothing to say. He anxiously awaits the Flagship.
Tully is busy inspecting your Multiverse drive. "I wonder what the Flagship's drive looks like. I wonder how big the explosion would be if I detonated a grenade inside it..."
Tully hopes no civilians are harmed during your battle with the Flagship.
"I can't imagine all you've been through trying to get here. You have my respect, admiration, and curiosity."
Tully recommends calibrating the weapons one last time before the final fight.
Tully warns that you cannot backdown from the Flagship. Once you're fighting it head on, there's no turning back.
Tully misses the taste of chips, ever since he had to give them up as part of his training.
Tully has little to talk about other than preparations for the Flagship.
Though he was trained as a soldier, Tully wishes for galactic peace some day. He does however admit that's impossible and will never happen.
Tully wonders what new threats the Federation will face far far in the future, assuming you can defeat the Rebellion today.
Tully makes it clear that while stopping the Flagship is top priority, preventing anything like the drone massacre of Universe 0 is just as important.
Tully hopes you properly understand the lore, otherwise you'll be awfully confused what all this stuff means.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with Jerry?

JERRY DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Human] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Unique
	Stats: x0.5 combat damage
	Inherited Stats: 83% damage from suffocation, learns skills 10% faster.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Jerry tells you that he genuinely respects you. That probably sounds really cheesy, but he doesn't care.
Jerry is busy dancing in his room. He invites you to join him, but you have other things to do.
Jerry is teaching the other crew how to build a card tower. Unfortunately there weren't any cards on the ship, so they're using their imagination.
Jerry is practicing his aim with his pillow. So far he hasn't hit a single shot, which is probably a good thing if he wants to sleep tonight.
Jerry isn't a devout pacifist, but he doesn't usually like to get involved in combat.
Jerry wishes the ship audio library had a larger database of music. Or any music at all, really.
Jerry hopes people still stop asking him to be the best man at their weddings. He can only attend so many before he goes insane.
Jerry says his mother always said he looked good in a uniform. He just hopes she wouldn't be disappointed in him now, standing here in a Rebel outfit.
Jerry likes his uncle, but he just wished he wasn't such a genocidal murderer.
Jerry feels, deep down, that he exists only because some guy made a dumb joke in a suggestion channel that went too far. Wayyyy too far.
Jerry wants a pet spider. Well not really, but he thinks it might be cool.
Jerry wonders how the Jerome Protectorate will be while he's away. He also really wants to change that name to something less stupid.
Jerry confirms that his full name is Jerome Wentworth. Surprisingly, that doesn't feel like a reference to something for once.
Jerry doesn't understand why his uncle hates non-humans so much. Jerry is friends with a couple aliens, and all of them were cool. Except for that one Mantis that always tried to eat his arms...

Jerry cannot be cloned as he is not dead.
Jerry cannot be cloned as he is not dead.
Jerry cannot be cloned as he is not dead.
Jerry cannot be cloned as he is not dead.

JERRY (Grief) DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Human] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Unique
	Stats: Takes 83% fire and suffocation damage. x1.5 combat damage, x0.6 movement speed, x3 sabotage speed, 50% damage taken from combat.
	Wields a Gatling gun which fires at 10x speed, killing crew rapidly and quickly blasting open doors.
What do you want to do with Jerry?
Jerry gets off of his horse...
Jerry cannot be cloned as he is not dead.

	SPECIES? [Human] SUBTYPE? [Yes]

	Wields a Gatling gun which fires at 20x speed, killing crew rapidly and quickly blasting open doors.
What do you want to do with Haynes?

DETECTIVE DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Human] SUBTYPE? [Yes]

data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Haynes promises his name's resemblance to another, famous Old Earth detective is purely a coincidence.
Before becoming a Multiverse Renegade himself, Haynes used to live on Earth. However, he had to leave his home behind when Archive Inc. could no longer hold back the Vek threat.
Haynes is polishing his prized revolver. He claims to have had the thing since a child, and takes it with him anywhere he goes.

Haynes has worked up quite the reputation with the Militia, but has never considered joining their ranks. The life of a soldier doesn't fit him quite as well as "reality-hopping vigilante and detective" does. Nor does it sound nearly as cool.
Haynes wonders what will happen with Amy and Daniel now that two of their former co-workers turned out to be Rebel spies.
Haynes despises the Rebellion. There's nothing worse in Haynes's mind than a tyrant flying the flag of a supposed hero.
Haynes offers to someday teach you how to fire a gun as fast as him, but you aren't too hopeful you'll ever be as good as him.
Haynes finds, on principle, the smaller the gun, the more efficient it is in ship-board combat.

Haynes claims Slugs really aren't as tricky as they claim to be. Just in case though, he always wears a layer of tinfoil inside his hat to counteract their telepathic abilities. You aren't sure why no one else has tried this if it really works that well.
Haynes thinks the outfit makes the man. Unfortunately, it's kind of hard to tell what people are wearing at this scale.
Haynes isn't quite sure why people usually refer to him by his last name when his first is much more recognizeable.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with your Angel?

ANGEL DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Human] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite
	Stats: x1.3 damage with an additional x1.7 damage in ranged combat. Takes 30% less damage from combat. Takes 50% less damage from fires and asphyxiation and is stunned for 10% of the usual duration. Has maximum skill level. Does not lose skills from cloning.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: You attempt to speak to your Angel, but they cannot hear you over the ruckus of their painfully loud death metal.
You just realized you've never seen your Angel without their helmet on. When you confront them about it, they ignore you.
Your Angel can't remember much of their life before undergoing their training. The only life they know now is that of service to Vael. And you, though that one's still up in the air.
Your Angel threatens that if you mock Vael in front of them, they'll break all of your fingers. Not that they have a choice - this behavior is programmed into them.
Your Angel finally tries to open up to you and talk about something, but has absolutely nothing to say. Seems, in the end, being uninteresting is hardwired into all humans.
According to your Angel, their armor isn't authentic. Only the original 12 Angels received the armor of an actual Ace to wear, and every Angel after that was simply given a replica.

Your Angel expresses their admiration for the likes of Taurus, one of the best trained Angels in the entire Syndicate. But he assures you he admires no one more than Vael. If he did, he'd have no choice but to kill himself.
You've noticed a lot of strange, cult-like behavior from your Angel regarding Vael. You can only wonder if MFK Aces have similar obsessions with Vance.

You watch as your Angel silently goes about applying a new layer of paint to their armor. They explain that it is quiet moments like these that they're able to stifle the murderous voices in their head. So don't interrupt them.

You admonish your Angel for once again using their rifle to shoot at insects that made their way onto the ship. They assure you they know what they're doing, and promptly shoot out one of the lights while trying to hit a mosquito.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with your Engi?

ENGI DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Engi] SUBTYPE? [No]
	Subtype Details: Genetic, Standard
	Stats: 90 Health, x2 repair and extinguishing speed, x0.5 combat damage, 75% damage from suffocation.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your Engi is in a panicked state, desperately arguing with one of its nanobot components which has refused to perform its job at doing nothing. You leave your Engi alone.
The Engi expresses how much it desires to return to the Harmony as soon as the mission is over.
Your Engi hugs you awkwardly, and almost immediately apologizes. It claims it saw some humans performing it, and wanted to try it on someone else.
Your Engi lectures you on how you need to take better care of your equipment.
Your Engi explains that the concept of friendship does not exist for it, but if it did, then you would most likely be its friend.
Your Engi complains about the unnecessary usage of oxygen, and recommends that the other crew breathe less.
You ask your Engi what it feels like being made up of many smaller nanobots. Your Engi isn't sure what you mean, and asks the same about being made up of many cells.

Your Engi explains that several of its friends had previously been taken as slaves by the Mantis Hive. You offer your condolences, but the Engi doesn't seem very upset. You aren't even sure if it can be upset.
Your Engi appears to be watering a small alien plant. It cautiously orders you not to approach, in fear that you might step on the plant.
Your Engi advises that you invest more into drone technology.
Your Engi doesn't understand the concept of conversation.
You take a seat and watch as your Engi makes repairs on its own body. It's rather interesting to watch, but after a while you get bored and leave.
Your Engi tells you that the Harmony does not encourage emotions. The Engi isn't sure how it feels about this.

You look around for your Engi but struggle to find them. You look around their quarters but find absolutely nothing. In fact, their quarters are exactly the same way they came when you first got this ship.
The Engi explains that the Harmony has mixed opinions on the Federation. It allows the involvement of the Engi in Federation business only for its own potential gain.
Your Engi is busy repainting a section of the interior which it has deemed unsatisfactory.
Your Engi explains that it once desired to join the Arcadia Corporation, but ever since the Corporation fell out of the grace of the Rebellion, it was too dangerous of a dream to pursue.
Out of curiosity, you ask your Engi how they can still have some free will when the Harmony holds control over them. Your Engi won't respond.
Your Engi beeps at you. You aren't sure how you feel about it.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with your Engi Defender?
Have your Engi help with upgrading the drones.

DEFENDER DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Engi] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Elite
	Stats: x2.7 repair speed, takes 70% damage from fire and suffocation, x0.35 combat damage
	Ability (30s cooldown, 15s duration): Shields temporarily. Damage from all sources reduced by 90%, and resists mind control.
	Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.
Your Defender has spent years operating and building drones. They can upgrade the system for cheaper than normal.
Your Dronebay is too weak for your Defender to help.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the system.
Your Dronebay is too powerful for your Defender to work on them.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: You find your Defender calibrating its shield. You decide not to bother it.
Your Defender thinks you need more Defense drones to protect the ship.
Your Defender explains it was chosen by the Harmony to serve its purpose as a Defender. So long as the Federation is saved, the Harmony will forgive it for joining your ship. Most likely.
Your Defender doesn't want to talk unless it involves making improvements on the ship.
Your Defender thinks crew sleep schedules are unnecessary.
Your Defender advises you to avoid fighting civilian ships. It only approves of self-defense or mercy kills.
Your Defender wonders if you have a program controlling your cells, since you cannot change your physical form either.
Your Defender doesn't think reality being a simulation is too far of a stretch, because it is literally controlled by one.
Your Defender asks why you would ever use a calculator for math when you have themselves to help.
The Defender asks if you have a task for it. You tell it you just wanted to talk, and it walks away.
You try telling your Defender a joke but it doesn't understand.
Your Defender tells you a story about how it once had an emotion, and had to spend a week removing it from its systems.
Your Defender does not fear the Mantis invaders, because a life of slavery is about the same as being controlled by the Harmony 24/7.
Your Defender advises you do not use it in combat unless absolutely necessary.
Your Defender thinks you need more Ion tech.
Your Defender advises you invest more into hacking tech.
Your Defender informs you that all Engi come with a built-in stereo system that they are not allowed to use. You can't understand why it is telling you this.
You try to play a game of tic-tac-toe with your Defender. Unsurprisingly, you always end up tying. Your Defender does not comprehend why it cannot win.
Your Defender advises you give all of the crew shield tech.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with your Separatist Engi?

SEPARATIST DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Engi] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard
	Stats: x1.75 repair and extinguishing speed. x0.75 combat damage. 50% suffocation damage.
	Ability (7s cooldown, toggle mode): Switches between Nano or Solid mode.
	Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.
	Nano Mode Stats: Cannot fight, sabotage, heal, or repair. Immune to fire, suffocation and mind control. x0.7 move speed. 30% damage from all sources. Ignores doors.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your Separatist begins to speak to you in binary. You play with your translator, trying to make sure you're on the correct settings, until you realize the Separatist is literally just spewing numbers.
Your Separatist asks if it can have a Repair Drone all for himself. You tell them maybe some day.
You ask your Separatist what it was like breaking free from the Harmony. They tell you a long story about the internal struggle of purging the Harmony's code from its systems. It's really boring.
You spot your Separatist making modifications to its body. It asks if you desire to do the same, but it doesn't seem to understand that you can't rearrange your physical appearance on a whim.
Your Separatist explains how it wishes that it could be completely alone all the time.
You ask how your Separatist's day is going. It tells you that there is no "day" in space.
You spot your Separatist on its knees, staring at the ground. After asking a few questions, you learn that one of its nanobots has broken, and it is holding a funeral for it.
You try to speak to your Separatist, but it interrupts you to inform you that it doesn't care.
You try to find your Separatist, but it continues to walk away from you. You eventually give up.
Your Separatist wishes that you would replace all of the crew with drones.
Your Separatist asks if you have ever been shoved out an airlock against your will. You shake your head and take a few steps back, just in case.
Your Separatist has developed a fascination with old Earth poetry. It reads you a few lines from some poems it generated with a poem writing script it wrote.
Your Separatist asks if you have ever created an Artificial Intelligence yourself. When you say no, it huffs and walks away.

Your Separatist offers you a drone schematic for a spherical robot that shouts insults at your crew to motivate them. You thank them and burn the schematic before it can be entered in the ship's database.
Your Separatist asks if it can download the dictionary built into the ship's database, which you allow.
Your Separatist complains about the futility of existence.
Your Separatist reflects on how space should be more empty.
Your Separatist asks you about love, and whether it should go through the effort to write a love simulation program for itself.
Your Separatist wishes it had bones instead of a titanium alloy endoskeleton.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with Turzil?

TURZIL DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Engi] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Unique
	Stats: 115 health, x1.4 movement speed, x0.4 repair speed. Takes 80% damage from combat, takes 50% damage from asphyxiation, takes 40% damage from fire, is immune to mind control. Learns skills 20% faster.
	Ability (20s cooldown, 25s duration): Shields all friendly crew in the room including himself temporarily. Shielded crew take 90% less damage from combat and repair 4x faster. Also gains immunity to mind control (does not stop the effect if already in progress).
	Ability cooldown type: Refills on jump.
	Aura: Friendly crew in the same room repair 50% faster.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: You find Turzil's room full of half-painted canvases of beautiful scenery. The Engi spots you looking at them and pushes you out of the room and shuts the door. Seems Turzil still struggles with expression even after separating from the Harmony.
You find Turzil walking around the ship missing his left arm. He explains that it is "behaving poorly and currently in a time out."

You find Turzil banging himself against the wall repeatedly. You try to help him, but he stops you. "Do not [worry]. I am simply -applying- percusive maintenance. I was [informed] it is effective by human engineers."

Turzil is absolutely terrified of the concept of having emotions, but is extremely glad he is, like all Engis, completely incapable of feeling strongly about anything. This has all left you very confused.
It seems Turzil has stuck a number of yellow sheets of paper onto the walls of his room. You ask about it, and he just complains about the lack of paint aboard the ship.

Turzil misses Tully quite a bit. The last time the two saw each other was several decades ago during the Last Stand at Node 17. You ask if it's usual for Engi to feel such things, and he immediately tenses up and gets defensive.

Out of cursiosity, you question Turzil about Engi ships and reproduction. Turzil looks at you strangely but provides a long and boring lecture about how Engi ships are technically 'alive' and exchange matter similar to normal biological reproduction. It's honestly quite mundane, nothing like the crazy tales you frequently hear other Renegades sharing.

You ask Turzil why he and other Separatists have different colors from normal Engis. Turzil explains that the concept of dyeing your nanites different colors to distinguish yourself has been a long lasting Separatist tradition. What Turzil doesn't explain however is why he has chosen to paint himself blue and yellow.

You find Turzil staring out one of the ship's rear windows, watching a comet fly past. "Curious. I have heard [stories] that many creatures... place... -wishes-? Yes, wishes, upon these frozen bodies of ice and dust. I have tried doing the [same]. Will it come true? I hope so..."
Turzil is pacing around one of the exterior doors to the cargo bay. When he spots you watching him, he stops and returns back to the ship, giving you a suspicious look that you match.

You go to question Turzil about why you've found a number of strange geometric scribbles lodged in various parts of the ship, but he is nowhere to be found. Strangely, whenever you go to ask him a question like this, he always disappears.

You find Turzil playing around with several electrical wires. You warn him not to screw with the ship, but it's too late. The ship goes black and Turzil vibrates with an electric shock. For a few moments, you swear the shield of the entire ship turns yellow, but after a few seconds it goes back to the normal blue, and the lights come back on.

Turzil worries sometimes about his maniac habits. It's not unusual for Separatists to exhibit strange characteristics after liberation, but Turzil cannot help but constantly obsess over the color yellow and paint. He hopes he is not going insane. Or becoming an artist.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with your Zoltan?

ZOLTAN DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Zoltan] SUBTYPE? [No]
	Subtype Details: Genetic, Standard
	Stats: 75 Health, provides 1 power.
	On Death: 15 damage to enemy crew
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your Zoltan requests that you study the Zoltan code of law in better detail.
Your Zoltan promises they would never lie unless it was absolutely necessary.
Your Zoltan makes it clear that they disapprove of all this violence.
Your Zoltan requests that you do not force it to stand in the same room all day.
Your Zoltan inquires about your definition of happiness. It tells you that you gave it a really lame answer.
Your Zoltan tells you that there are no stupid questions, but there are plenty of annoying ones.
You ask what it's like to be made of pure energy. Your Zoltan laughs and informs you that it is only composed of 98% energy.
Your Zoltan thinks you can never have too many Beams aboard your ship.
Your Zoltan questions the ethics of murdering enemy crew, and wishes everyone could just get along.
Your Zoltan tries to get into a conversation involving politics with you, but you assure them you have important things to do and hide in your quarters.
Your Zoltan wishes that you would avoid killing Engi ships as much as possible. Killing Rebels however, it can understand.
Your Zoltan expresses concerns around the Duskbringer uprising in the Zoltan sectors. You try to assure them that once the Rebellion is dealt with, the Federation will be able to help.
Your Zoltan is curious how the Coalition formed between the 4 more aggressive races in the galaxy.
Your Zoltan encourages that you enforce proper hygiene among the crew.
Your Zoltan tells you that he's always looked up to the monks who spend their entire lives practicing pacifism.
Your Zoltan wishes you would brush your teeth more often.
Your Zoltan doesn't understand why he must be limited to a humanoid form, but is unable to reshape himself.
Your Zoltan hopes you won't keep him in the shields for eternity.
You go to shake your Zoltan's hand, but pull away in pain when you're zapped. Your Zoltan apologizes.

Have your Peacekeeper help with upgrading the reactor.

PEACEKEEPER DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Zoltan] SUBTYPE? [Yes]

Your Peacekeeper, being an entity made of energy, knows a thing or two about power. They can upgrade the reactor for cheaper than normal.
Your reactor is too weak for your Peacekeeper to help.

Your crew is successfully able to upgrade the reactor.
Your reactor is too powerful for your Peacekeeper to work on it.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your Peacekeeper orders you to drop down and do twenty push-ups, and when you remind them that you are the captain, they drop down and give you fourty instead.
Your Peacekeeper is busy trying to get the other crew to stand in a straight line while waiting to get food.
Your Peacekeeper suggests putting them in the shields to prevent Ion damage.
Your Peacekeeper finds no irony in their title, and refuses to talk to you about it.
Your Peacekeeper elects themselves as the ship's mediator for any debates that may occur.
Your Peacekeeper boasts how Zoltans are the only race with 4 different color schemes.
Your Peacekeeper takes pride in their daily routine and excellent self-hygiene.
Your Peacekeeper thinks automated vessels are an excellent way of managing the commonwealth without putting crew at risk.
Your Peacekeeper warns you to disregard their description, and they will absolutely never kick you in the teeth.
Your Peacekeeper suggests that you exercise better control over the rest of the crew.
Your Peacekeeper hopes you will hurry with the mission, because they have a job to do watching over the citizens of the Zoltan Capital.
Your Peacekeeper is busy brainstorming ways to perform genocide on the pirate clans.
The computer informs you that your Peacekeeper is comatose in their quarters after fainting from powering the systems for too long.

Your Peacekeeper explains that the eye symbol on the Peacekeeper ships represents the Great Eye, a monolith constructed near a giant nebula resembling an eye in Zoltan territory. No one knows where the monolith came from.
Your Peacekeeper's favourite color is green. No surprise there.
Your Peacekeeper explains standard Zoltan ships are used for both civilian and military vessels, and sometimes even the two at the same time.
Your Peacekeeper was close to a promotion before they joined your crew. Or at least, so they claim.
Your Peacekeeper is busy taking a political-compass test.
data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/event[@name: What do you want to do with your Monk?

MONK DETAILS
	SPECIES? [Zoltan] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard
	Stats: Cannot fight or sabotage.
	Inherited Stats: 75 Health, provides 1 power.

	Ability (27s cooldown): 10s of stun to all crew in the room excluding themselves.

data/events_storage.xml$/FTL/textList[@n: Your Monk wishes for galactic peace. You try your hardest to control the urge to explain why that's impossible.
Your Monk repeats a random cryptic proverb and walks away.
Your Monk is busy meditating. You decide not to disturb them.
Your Monk is busy ironing out their robe. You decide not to disturb them.
Your Monk explains that after years of practice, they have managed to take control over the energy that makes up their body.
You quietly wonder how your Monk's robe manages to stay on all the time.
No matter how much you plead or reason, your Monk refuses to harm another being.
Your Monk recommends that you try going vegan.
Your Monk suggests attempting to negotiate with enemies rather than killing them.
Your Monk thinks the Monk ship design is the coolest of the Zoltan color schemes.
Your Monk sees no shame in hiding behind other people while they do the fighting.
Your Monk requests that you lecture the other crew on referring to them as a coward.
Your Monk finds mobility hard in their robe, sometimes wishing they could swap it out for something much lighter weight.
Your Monk admonishes other Monks who use Ion tech on their ships, claiming even the seemingly harmless Ion weapons can be used to kill.
Your Monk admires the religious nature of the Rock people, and their dedication to their faith.
Your Monk believes the Zoltan church system is corrupt and greedy, and that money is merely the fuel for selfish desires.
In case it wasn't clear, your Monk is a pacifist. They make sure to tell you this, multiple times.
Your Monk confesses to you that they once accidentally killed a bug that was bothering them, and breaks down into tears.

DEVOTEE DETAILS
	SPECIES? [ZOLTAN] SUBTYPE? [Yes]
	Subtype Details: Non-Genetic, Standard
	Stats: Learns combat and repair skills 20% faster
	Inherited Stats: 75 Health, provides 1 power
